perturbation.original_text: 7.5. Product Payment Terms. Payment terms are [*] from the date of acceptance by Sonos of an applicable invoice from IAC in accordance with Exhibit H and/or other applicable SOW, which acceptance may not be unreasonably withheld. IAC may not submit an invoice for a Product prior to that Product's transfer of title to Sonos. All payments shall be made in U.S. currency, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, by check or wire transfer (as may be agreed upon by the parties) to an account designated by IAC. Invoices for shall be remitted to: Sonos, Inc., Attn: Accounts Payable, 223 E. De La Guerra Street, Santa Barbara, CA, 93101, USA, and shall also sent by electronic mail on the date of the invoice to: [*]. Any alteration to the payment terms must be mutually agreed in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.5. Product Payment Terms. Payment terms are [*] from the date of acceptance by Sonos of an applicable invoice from IAC in accordance with Exhibit H and/or other applicable SOW, which acceptance may not be unreasonably withheld. IAC may not submit an invoice for a Product prior to that Product's transfer of title to Sonos. All payments shall be made in U.S. currency, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, by check or wire transfer (as may be agreed upon by the parties) to an account designated by IAC. However, for invoices exceeding $[*], payment terms are net thirty (30) days from the invoice date, irrespective of acceptance. Invoices for shall be remitted to: Sonos, Inc., Attn: Accounts Payable, 223 E. De La Guerra Street, Santa Barbara, CA, 93101, USA, and shall also sent by electronic mail on the date of the invoice to: [*]. Any alteration to the payment terms must be mutually agreed in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction regarding payment deadlines. The original clause states that payment terms are based on the date of acceptance of the invoice, but the modified clause introduces a new condition stating invoices exceeding a certain amount are due 30 days from the invoice date, regardless of acceptance. This creates ambiguity because it is not clearly defined when the payment should be made, which could lead to disputes over contractual obligations.

perturbation.original_text: 7.5. Product Payment Terms. Payment terms are [*] from the date of acceptance by Sonos of an applicable invoice from IAC in accordance with Exhibit H and/or other applicable SOW, which acceptance may not be unreasonably withheld. IAC may not submit an invoice for a Product prior to that Product's transfer of title to Sonos. All payments shall be made in U.S. currency, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, by check or wire transfer (as may be agreed upon by the parties) to an account designated by IAC. Invoices for shall be remitted to: Sonos, Inc., Attn: Accounts Payable, 223 E. De La Guerra Street, Santa Barbara, CA, 93101, USA, and shall also sent by electronic mail on the date of the invoice to: [*]. Any alteration to the payment terms must be mutually agreed in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.5. Product Payment Terms. Payment terms are [*] from the date of acceptance by Sonos of an applicable invoice from IAC in accordance with Exhibit H and/or other applicable SOW, which acceptance may not be unreasonably withheld. IAC may not submit an invoice for a Product prior to that Product's transfer of title to Sonos. However, IAC can also submit an invoice 15 days after the transfer of title regardless of acceptance by Sonos. All payments shall be made in U.S. currency, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the parties, by check or wire transfer (as may be agreed upon by the parties) to an account designated by IAC. Invoices for shall be remitted to: Sonos, Inc., Attn: Accounts Payable, 223 E. De La Guerra Street, Santa Barbara, CA, 93101, USA, and shall also sent by electronic mail on the date of the invoice to: [*]. Any alteration to the payment terms must be mutually agreed in writing by the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: Here, the original text states that payment happens after the invoice is accepted by Sonos. The new text introduces a condition where IAC can submit an invoice 15 days after the transfer of title, regardless of Sonos's acceptance. This creates a conflict about when the payment process should begin, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 7.1. Product Prices. Unless otherwise mutually agreed, the price to be paid by Sonos for any Product manufactured by IAC hereunder will be quoted based on the calculation of the pricing formula described in Exhibit G and the Shipping Term described by Section 6.5. Subject to Section 7.6, the Price for any given Product shall be governed by the pricing formula set forth in Exhibit G and based on pricing formula inputs that are applicable on the date a Product is manufactured by IAC. In cases where a Product's price paid by Sonos is not equal to the applicable pricing formula calculation, the difference will be settled by the PPV process described herein. [*].
perturbation.changed_text: 7.1. Product Prices. Unless otherwise mutually agreed, the price to be paid by Sonos for any Product manufactured by IAC hereunder will be quoted based on the calculation of the pricing formula described in Exhibit G and the Shipping Term described by Section 6.5. Subject to Section 7.6, the Price for any given Product shall be governed by the pricing formula set forth in Exhibit G and based on pricing formula inputs that are applicable on the date a Product is manufactured by IAC. However, for any Component constituting more than 10% of the total BOM cost, the pricing shall be based on the cost at the time of Purchase Order placement. In cases where a Product's price paid by Sonos is not equal to the applicable pricing formula calculation, the difference will be settled by the PPV process described herein. [*].
perturbation.explanation: The contradiction lies in the timing of pricing formula inputs. The original clause specifies that product price is based on the pricing inputs on the date of manufacture. The modified clause introduces an exception, stating that the cost of Components (over 10% of BOM) will be determined at the time of Purchase Order placement. This creates uncertainty about what data the pricing should be calculated from, creating ambiguity in enforcement.
